info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.usage
info.description: Resource usage and pricing custom APIs

post.description: List current usage details per tenant and namespace. Some usage have only sense in the system namespace and this selector has no effect on it.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace

x-example: "system"
Namespace to be considered

post.description:
List the usage divided by hour. The usage is hourly aggregated, from the start of utc hour
to the end of utc hour. It is used to see the detailed breakdown of the usage received from ListUsageDetails

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

schemausageStatusType.description:
All possible usage line statuses

 - STATUS_UNKNOWN: No value defined
 - STATUS_NO_DATA: No data
 - STATUS_NOT_MEASURED: No measured
 - STATUS_ACTIVE: Active
schemausageStatusType.title: Status type

usageCalculatedUsageItem.description: One line of usage, including pricing details
usageCalculatedUsageItem.title: CalculatedUsageItem

amount.description:
Cost as hundredths of currency

Example: ` "1234"`
amount.title: Amount

end_timestamp.description:
End of the time unit

Example: ` "2020-04-20T12:32:51.341959216Z"`
end_timestamp.title: Timestamp end

fixed.description: Means that this data came not from usage (reserved flag for support/discount/onboarding fees)
fixed.title: Fixed

metric_labels.description:
id of the corresponding aggregated_usage metric labels from which this calculated usage item is assembled

Example: ` "['container-usage-large', 'container-usage-medium']"`
metric_labels.title: Metric labels

quantity_billable.description:
quantity which is used to calculate the amount. Rounded from quantity as the following:
 * after converting quantity from unit_code to unit_code of this addon_id, if the value < 1, then
 quantity_billable is rounded to 1
 * after converting quantity from unit_code to unit_code of this addon_id, if the value > 1, then
  quantity_billable is rounded down to the nearest value.

Example: ` 115`
quantity_billable.title: Quantity billable

start_timestamp.description:
Beginning of the time unit

Example: ` "2020-04-20T12:32:51.341959216Z"`
start_timestamp.title: Timestamp start

unit_name.description:
Name of the quantity unit

Example: ` "MB"`
unit_name.title: Unit name

unit_name_billable.description:
Unit name a quantity_billable is provided in

Example: ` GB`
unit_name_billable.title: Unit name billable

usage_type.description:
Type of the resource

Example: ` "ADN App Mgmt - VoltStack Large Containers"`
usage_type.title: Usage type
usage_type.x-ves-example: ADN App Mgmt - VoltStack Large Containers

usageCoupon.description: Coupon details, discount type, amount and name
usageCoupon.title: Coupon

discount_amount.description:
[x-required]
 If discount_type is fixed_amount, discount_amount is in cents
 If discount_type is percentage, discount_amount is in percentages of 0.01% precision (12.35% equals to 1235)

Example: ` "1234"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
discount_amount.title: Discount amount

title.description:
Title (or name) of the coupon

Example: ` "Coupon 1"`
title.title: Title

usageDiscountType.description:
Indicates what type of discount is applied for a coupon: fixed price or percentage.

unknown
The specified amount will be given as discount.
The specified percentage will be given as discount.
usageDiscountType.title: Discount type

usageHourlyItem.description: One line of usage by an hour. One hour as the least resolution.
usageHourlyItem.title: Hourly usage item

container.description:
Container name if this item correspond to the container usage. Otherwise it's empty

Example: ` "pa4-deployment1-abcd12"`
container.title: Container

deployment.description:
[x-required]
 Deployment name if this item correspond to the container usage. Otherwise it's empty

Example: ` "pa4-deployment1"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
deployment.title: Deployment

end_timestamp.description:
End of the time unit

Example: ` "2020-04-20T12:32:51.341959216Z"`
end_timestamp.title: Timestamp end

start_timestamp.description:
Beginning of the time unit

Example: ` "2020-04-20T12:32:51.341959216Z"`
start_timestamp.title: Timestamp start

unit_name.description:
Name of the quantity unit

Example: ` "MB"`
unit_name.title: Unit name

Encoded query which is passed as is to barracute daemon

Example: ` "{'MetricLabel':'label'}"`

hourly_breakdown.description:
An array of HourlyItem with usage per hour. The sum of these items will result into the parent's object `quantity`
 Deprecated: use /hourly_usage_details along with hourly_breakdown_query
hourly_breakdown.title: Hourly breakdown

hourly_breakdown_query.description:
[x-required]
 A base64 encoded json which should be passed as is to /hourly_usage_details
 to get hourly items for this aggregated usage.

Example: ` "{'MetricLabel':'label'}"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
hourly_breakdown_query.title: Hourly breakdown query

metric_label.description:
[x-required]
 id of the usage type. As Usage type is shown for user and is a subject of frequent changes,
 this metric_label should be static and should be usage for mapping between calculated usage and aggregated_usage.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
metric_label.title: Metric label

namespace.description:
Namespace where the usage occurred

Example: ` "system"`
namespace.title: Namespace

object_name.description:

Example: ` "pa4-resource1"`
